intro: Triumfetta neghelliensis var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved triumfetta, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically has ovate to elliptic leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
